First of all, I have to admit that I'm not a zombie fan and, unfortunately, that kept me away from this title. But, I was looking for a good strategy game that wasn't limited by 10 or 20 levels; something I could play a lot and often, that would take a bit to master, and wasn't thumb-reaction based. WotZ seemed to fit the bill. Usually, I play turn-based RPGs on my tablet and ARPGs on my PC. I also now own a couple JRPGs (tablet), but could never find a good RTS that I liked. I always return to Baldur's Gate type games (KotOR, Shadowrun, etc.) but need a break from those every so often. I am also a big fan of having to use my brain. If you are anything like me, don't pass on WotZ! It is unique and almost exactly what I was looking for (I say "almost" only because I haven't come close to mastering it yet; half the challenge for me is mastering the game). I highly recommend the game and, as a bonus, no IAP and it is continuously developed. For revenue purposes though, I recommend a donate button be added somewhere inconspicuous. -1 star for no proper WEB site, only a Facebook page that is totally useless for people who don't have an account (and don't want one).
